NAK The fact that NDM had not done a PEA was not a deterrent to Anglo in 2006 when it entered into the joint venture agreement for 50 of Pebble for 15 billion NDM did not complete a PEA until 2011 It was only then that they were legally able to talk about the resources they had at Pebble Pebble has no reserves of ore as the disclaimer tells us because a PreFeasibility Study PFS has yet to be done Only after a PFS can NDM legally talk about ore or Pebbles orebody because ore is defined as a mineral that can be mined at a profit and it is the PFS that determines that A PFS will also determine the extent of Pebbles reserves in the proven and probable categories

NAK A MAJORITY of the commercial fisherman DONT LIVE IN BRISTOL BAY or even ALASKA dont believe me Go there right now prove me wrong I was in Dillingham all last year This is a hidden sad truth

NAK Anyone who doesnt believe me go to Dillingham there probably is not 1 Alaska resident working at Icicle or Peter Pan or US CITIZEN for that matter IMMIGRANT EORKERS They hitchike down Wood River Road everyday and bum rides They are very nice people but still IMMIGRANT WORKERS

NAK FACTSAlaska is 100 reliant on natural resources for State funding I am 100 concious about the importance of preserving the fish BUT almost 100 of the fish processing laborers in Bristol Bay Region is IMMIGRANT WORKERS ON A VISA FROM RUSSIA JAMAICA etc Icicle and Peter Pan use almost 100 immigrant workers All the locals that supposedly profit off the fishing which is world class I admit consists of MOSTLY OUT OF STATE FISHERMAN THAT STORE THEIR BOATS IN DILLINGHAM AND NAKNEK THAT COME UP FROM LOWER 48 There are locals and Alaskan residents that support their families by commercial fishing yes but the numbers are very small Mostly OUT OF STATE peoppe that come in suck the revenue out of the inlet and take their money out of state never to be seen by the Alaska Dept of Treasury

NAK All bears Enlighten us on the disaster risk Ask yourself first before answeringHave you been to the Pebble SiteHave you Been to Bristol BayAre you an Alaska residentDo you understand that the Mining Resources in Alaska and how our taxable structure is setup The Pebble Site LOOKS NO DIFFERENT THEN RED DOG MINE I have seen BOTH Irs no different I am going to Illiamna later this summer if you t me to fly over it and snap some photos

NAK litig8 the salt lake mines location and risk potential to the surrounding area is apples to organges when compared to pebble The low grade ore combined with the disaster risk the amount of money spent funding pebble and the politcal sentiment make the two mines uncomparable Your logic is ok from a numbers stand point but not an investors

NAK Newbie Fact Rhenium is a precious metal found in the periodic table in the transitional metals group This metal is a byproduct of refining molybdenum and copper ores As an investment opportunity rhenium is one of the top ten most expensive metals known surpassing silver

NAK JOEL doing a DEEP DIVE for Due Diligence All about hypotheticals We CAN and DO make this stuff upSCIENCE is NOT required Essentially what we are marketing is a HORROR STORY to the publicThe mining company is hamstrung THEY have to stick to the FACTS

NAK If you want to see what Pebble will ultimately look like check out the Bingham Canyon mine being operated by Rio Tinto Like Pebble it is also a massive porphyry coppergoldmolysilver deposit There is also like Pebble rhenium present in the moly concentrate Bingham Canyons open pit is the largest manmade excavation in the world and they have been constantly expanding it ever since they began operations in 1906 And UltimateJeeves knock that Pebbles copper is low grade is without substance Binghams copper is 047 and Pebbles grades are much better than that DDH 6348 intersected 125 copper over nearly 1000 feet miningtechnologycomproje And over the years Bingham Canyon has been very very profitable despite being a lowgrade copper mine
